member.name: M:VCC.SharedFolder.ShareExistingFolder(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{VCC.SharePermissionEntry},System.String)
member.summary: Shares an existing folder on the local computer or on a remote computer
member.param: An optional comment/description for the share
The local path to the folder to be shared. If creating share on a remote computer then the path must be local to the remote computer. Do not use UNC paths
The share permissions to assign to this share
OPTIONAL - the remote computer name to create the share on

member.name: M:VCC.strategy_network.checkNetwork
member.summary: this function is invoked only for professors

member.name: P:VCC.SharePermissionEntry.DomainName
member.summary: The domain name that the user/group in the UserOrGroupName property belongs to

member.name: P:VCC.SharePermissionEntry.UserOrGroupName
member.summary: The name of the user or group that should be granted/denied permission

member.name: P:VCC.SharePermissionEntry.Permission
member.summary: The share permission to grant or deny for the account in UserOrGroupName

member.name: P:VCC.SharePermissionEntry.AllowOrDeny
member.summary: Set to True to allow the rights specified in the Permission property and False to deny the rights specified in the Permission property. Default is True.

member.name: M:VCC.SharePermissionEntry.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the SharePermissionEntry class

member.name: M:VCC.SharePermissionEntry.#ctor(System.String,System.String,VCC.SharedFolder.SharePermissions,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the SharePermissionEntry class and populates each of the properties within the instance
member.param: The domain that the user in the AccountName argument belongs to. Pass String.Empty or Nothing here if you are specifying a 'well known' identity such as the Everyone group in the AccountName argument
The username or group name that this permission entry relates to
True to allow the permission, False to deny the permission
